New Records: Yamamoto joined Orel Hershiser, Jerry Reuss, Sandy Koufax, and Johnny Podres as the only Dodgers pitchers with a scoreless start of at least five innings in a winner-take-all postseason game.
Key Match Events: The Dodgers got home runs from Kiké Hernández and Teoscar Hernández to beat the San Diego Padres 2-0
The teams combined to retire 26 consecutive batters — the longest streak in a single game in postseason history.
Darvish gave up an early home run to Kiké Hernández, then set down 14 in a row.
Pre-Game Insights: Analysts predicted a close game between the two rival teams
The manager emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance
Post-Match Reflections: A smiling Freddie Freeman said 'It's pretty sweet'
A soaked Kiké Hernández said 'We're the ones popping bottles now'
A devastated Manny Machado said 'It's a devastating one for sure'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was watched on Saturday morning in Japan.
The game was watched by a Hollywood contingent of Brad Pitt, Rob Lowe, Bryan Cranston, and Jimmy Kimmel.
The game was attended by a sellout crowd of 53,183, including Los Angeles Lakers superstar LeBron James.
